app.name: bcal
app.one_liner: A REPL CLI utility for storage expression evaluation, SI/IEC conversion, byte address calculation, base conversion and LBA/CHS calculation.

screens.name: REPL Prompt
screens.purpose: Primary interface for entering and evaluating storage and arithmetic expressions.
primary_actions: Show bit positions of a number

rust_commands.name: exit
rust_commands.purpose: Exit the REPL session cleanly (alias for quit).

rust_commands.name: show_bit_positions
rust_commands.purpose: Display bit positions with their values for a given number.

rust_commands.name: toggle_calc_mode
rust_commands.purpose: Switch between storage unit evaluation and general-purpose calculation mode.

mvp_plan: week 1: Add support for SI/IEC storage unit conversion
week 1: Implement REPL loop with expression parsing
week 1: Integrate basic arithmetic and bitwise operations
week 1: Store and reuse last valid result
week 1: Support base conversion (binary, decimal, hex)
acceptance_tests: Bitwise operations (AND, OR, XOR, shifts) produce correct results.
General-purpose calculations work without dependency on external tools like bc or calc.
Program handles undefined input without breaking the terminal.
User can enter 'quit' or 'exit' to terminate the program without error.
